result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Popple was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J. Popple is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael J. Popple was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (>1000-2500g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety with random UA's and PBTs upon request; no use of any controlled substances without a valid prescription; DNA sample ordered.

timeConds.notes:
May be served in Lafayette County if they will accept; Huber allowed for employment; no credit for time served and no sentence credit.

**On 01/18/2019, JOC amended to allow defendant 66 days credit.  This sentence is to be served per motion and order of the Court.  Report date for jail sentence:  02/17/2019 by 6:00 pm.  Defendant may serve in any county in the State of Wisconsin, if available**

09:40 AM Defendant Michael J. Popple in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion filed by defense.  Atty Meyer-O'Day advises the Court the request is for a stay of jail time and credit for time served.  State responds.  Court orders credit for 66 days, but will not modify the order any further.  Atty Meyer-O'Day requests 30 days for report date.  Court approves 30 days - report date 02/17/2019 by 6:00 pm.  Request to allow defendant to serve in any county of jail of the State of Wisconsin.

records.addlTxt: Faxed JOC to jail in am

Defendant Michael J. Popple in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ms. Jansen of Probation/parole present, too.  Court hears counsel - they have received PSI.  Court hears argument/recommendations from Attorney Allen; Court hears Attorney Meyer O'Day's argument/recommendation.  Court hears Michael Popple.  
Court addresses all - considers the nature of the offense and other sentencing considerations, and considers situation of defendant.
Court enters sentence as follows:
Sentence withheld, probation  40 months.  Conditions of probation:  6 months conditional jail time ordered - Jail time may be served in Lafayette County if they will accept him.  , DNA sample ordered, Huber allowed for employment; court costs and supervision fees, AODA counseling and follow through as requested by agent; no possession or use of any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Absolute sobriety with random UAs, and PBTs (breath, blood or urine) upon request. No credit for time served and no sentece credit.  Court orders stay of conditional jail time only pending appeal.  All other conditions are in place immediately.
Court admonishes defendant.
of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief

Defendant Michael J. Popple in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Continuation from motion hearing on October 12, 2016.  Atty Allen calls Officer Rider as witness, sworn and testified.  Cross examination.  Atty Allen calls Officer J. Wetter as witness, sworn and testified.  Cross examination.
Court hears from Atty Allen on argument of motion.  Atty Meyer-O'Day gives response and reply argument.  Atty Allen responds.
Court gives basis for ruling - motion to suppress denied.  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.
from Richland Co. Court Reporter re filing of 10/12/2016 Motion hearing transcript
of Motion Hearing on October 12, 2016
Motion hearing on November 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Appearances stated:  ADA Matt Allen, Atty. Jeremiah Meyer-O'Day, Michael Popple.  Ct. hears from ADA Matt Allen and Atty. Meyer-O'Day re Arraignment.  Proceeds with Arraignment, waive formal reading.  Ct. reads charges.  Def. stands mute and Ct. enters not guilty pleas.  Joshua Rider sworn in and testifies.  Cross by Atty. Meyer-O-Day.  Re-direct by ADA Matt Allen.  Ct. addresses Officer Rider re relationship with Ms. Lengyel.  Atty. Meyer-O'Day questions Officer Rider re Ms. Lengyel.  Officer Jerron Wetter sworn in and testifies.  Questioned by ADA Matt Allen.  ADA Matt Allen requests playing of recorded statements of Brittany Popple and Rachel Knight - Ct. requires CD of statements, ADA Allen will make copy of CD for file.  Plays statements of Brittany Popple and Rachel Knight.  ADA Matt Allen continues questioning of Officer Wetter.  ADA Allen plays video of home layout.  After video ADA Allen continues questioning of Officer Wetter.  Cross by Atty. Meyer-O'Day.  Redirect by ADA Matt Allen.  No further evidence from the State.  Ct. hears from Atty. Meyer-O'Day re witnesses.  Ct. hears from ADA Allen requesting adjournment to allow Officer Hofkes to testify.  Ct. said Officer Hofkes spoke to witnesses and finds issues are the protective sweep scale and community caretaker issue.  Brittany Popple sworn in and testifies.  Cross by ADA Matt Allen.  Redirect by Atty. Meyer-O'Day.  William Knight sworn in and testifies.  Questioned by Atty. Meyer-O'Day.  Redirect by ADA Matt Allen.  Ct. sets another brief hearing 11/8/2016 at 1:30 p.m. to recall Officer Wetter and to obtain testimony from Officer Hofkes.  CD marked as Ex. 1
Preliminary Hearing - 08/26/2016

Defendant Michael J. Popple in court, in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Jeremiah Meyer-O'Day appears specially for this hearing as no formal appointment of SPD has been made in this case yet.  Atty Meyer-O'Day waives reading of complaint.  Judge goes through complaint/charges.  $3000 signature bond - no possession/use of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Defense requests a $250 cash bond to preserve the right to credit.  State does not feel cash bond is necessary as defendant is already in custody on other matters, etc.  Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.  Status conference set for June 13, 2016, at 1:00 p.m.  No objection to the defendant appearing by video.
